00069 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00070 // Target
00071 
00072 bool
00073 Target::GetTarget(const char *arch, const char *cpu, const char *isa,
00074                   Target *t) {
00075     if (cpu == NULL) {
00076         std::string hostCPU = llvm::sys::getHostCPUName();
00077         if (hostCPU.size() > 0)
00078             cpu = hostCPU.c_str();
00079         else {
00080             fprintf(stderr, "Warning: unable to determine host CPU!\n");
00081             cpu = "generic";
00082         }
00083     }
00084     t->cpu = cpu;
00085 
00086     if (isa == NULL) {
00087         if (!strcasecmp(cpu, "atom"))
00088             isa = "sse2";
00089 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0_svn)
00090         else if (!strcasecmp(cpu, "sandybridge") ||
00091                  !strcasecmp(cpu, "corei7-avx"))
00092             isa = "avx";
00093 #endif // LLVM_3_0
00094         else
00095             isa = "sse4";
00096     }
00097     if (arch == NULL)
00098         arch = "x86-64";
00099 
00100     bool error = false;
00101 
00102     // Make sure the target architecture is a known one; print an error
00103     // with the valid ones otherwise.
00104     t->target = NULL;
00105     for (llvm::TargetRegistry::iterator iter = llvm::TargetRegistry::begin();
00106          iter != llvm::TargetRegistry::end(); ++iter) {
00107         if (std::string(arch) == iter->getName()) {
00108             t->target = &*iter;
00109             break;
00110         }
00111     }
00112     if (t->target == NULL) {
00113         fprintf(stderr, "Invalid architecture \"%s\"\nOptions: ", arch);
00114         llvm::TargetRegistry::iterator iter;
00115         for (iter = llvm::TargetRegistry::begin();
00116              iter != llvm::TargetRegistry::end(); ++iter)
00117             fprintf(stderr, "%s ", iter->getName());
00118         fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00119         error = true;
00120     }
00121     else {
00122         t->arch = arch;
00123     }
00124 
00125     if (!strcasecmp(isa, "sse2")) {
00126         t->isa = Target::SSE2;
00127         t->nativeVectorWidth = 4;
00128         t->vectorWidth = 4;
00129         t->attributes = "+sse,+sse2,-sse3,-sse41,-sse42,-sse4a,-ssse3,-popcnt";
00130     }
00131     else if (!strcasecmp(isa, "sse4")) {
00132         t->isa = Target::SSE4;
00133         t->nativeVectorWidth = 4;
00134         t->vectorWidth = 4;
00135         t->attributes = "+sse,+sse2,+sse3,+sse41,-sse42,-sse4a,+ssse3,-popcnt,+cmov";
00136     }
00137     else if (!strcasecmp(isa, "sse4x2")) {
00138         t->isa = Target::SSE4;
00139         t->nativeVectorWidth = 4;
00140         t->vectorWidth = 8;
00141         t->attributes = "+sse,+sse2,+sse3,+sse41,-sse42,-sse4a,+ssse3,-popcnt,+cmov";
00142     }
00143 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
00144     else if (!strcasecmp(isa, "avx")) {
00145         t->isa = Target::AVX;
00146         t->nativeVectorWidth = 8;
00147         t->vectorWidth = 8;
00148         t->attributes = "+avx,+popcnt,+cmov";
00149     }
00150     else if (!strcasecmp(isa, "avx-x2")) {
00151         t->isa = Target::AVX;
00152         t->nativeVectorWidth = 8;
00153         t->vectorWidth = 16;
00154         t->attributes = "+avx,+popcnt,+cmov";
00155     }
00156 #endif // LLVM 3.0
00157     else {
00158         fprintf(stderr, "Target ISA \"%s\" is unknown.  Choices are: %s\n", 
00159                 isa, SupportedTargetISAs());
00160         error = true;
00161     }
00162 
00163     if (!error) {
00164         llvm::TargetMachine *targetMachine = t->GetTargetMachine();
00165         const llvm::TargetData *targetData = targetMachine->getTargetData();
00166         t->is32bit = (targetData->getPointerSize() == 4);
00167     }
00168 
00169     return !error;
00170 }
00171 
00172 
00173 const char *
00174 Target::SupportedTargetCPUs() {
00175     return "atom, barcelona, core2, corei7, "
00176 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0_svn)
00177         "corei7-avx, "
00178 #endif
00179         "istanbul, nocona, penryn, "
00180 #ifdef LLVM_2_9
00181         "sandybridge, "
00182 #endif
00183         "westmere";
00184 }
00185 
00186 
00187 const char *
00188 Target::SupportedTargetArchs() {
00189     return "x86, x86-64";
00190 }
00191 
00192 
00193 const char *
00194 Target::SupportedTargetISAs() {
00195     return "sse2, sse4, sse4x2"
00196 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0_svn)
00197         ", avx, avx-x2"
00198 #endif
00199         ;
00200 }

00202 
00203 std::string
00204 Target::GetTripleString() const {
00205     llvm::Triple triple;
00206     // Start with the host triple as the default
00207     triple.setTriple(llvm::sys::getHostTriple());
00208 
00209     // And override the arch in the host triple based on what the user
00210     // specified.  Here we need to deal with the fact that LLVM uses one
00211     // naming convention for targets TargetRegistry, but wants some
00212     // slightly different ones for the triple.  TODO: is there a way to
00213     // have it do this remapping, which would presumably be a bit less
00214     // error prone?
00215     if (arch == "x86")
00216         triple.setArchName("i386");
00217     else if (arch == "x86-64")
00218         triple.setArchName("x86_64");
00219     else
00220         triple.setArchName(arch);
00221 
00222     return triple.str();
00223 }
00224 
00225 
00226 llvm::TargetMachine *
00227 Target::GetTargetMachine() const {
00228     std::string triple = GetTripleString();
00229 
00230 #if defined(LLVM_3_0svn) || defined(LLVM_3_0)
00231     std::string featuresString = attributes;
00232     llvm::TargetMachine *targetMachine = 
00233         target->createTargetMachine(triple, cpu, featuresString);
00234 #else
00235     std::string featuresString = cpu + std::string(",") + attributes;
00236     llvm::TargetMachine *targetMachine = 
00237         target->createTargetMachine(triple, featuresString);
00238 #endif
00239     assert(targetMachine != NULL);
00240 
00241     targetMachine->setAsmVerbosityDefault(true);
00242     return targetMachine;
00243 }

00246 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00247 // Opt
00248 
00249 Opt::Opt() {
00250     level = 1;
00251     fastMath = false;
00252     disableBlendedMaskedStores = false;
00253     disableCoherentControlFlow = false;
00254     disableUniformControlFlow = false;
00255     disableGatherScatterOptimizations = false;
00256     disableMaskedStoreToStore = false;
00257     disableGatherScatterFlattening = false;
00258     disableUniformMemoryOptimizations = false;
00259     disableMaskedStoreOptimizations = false;
00260 }

00265 Globals::Globals() {
00266     mathLib = Globals::Math_ISPC;
00267 
00268     includeStdlib = true;
00269     runCPP = true;
00270     debugPrint = false;
00271     disableWarnings = false;
00272     emitPerfWarnings = true;
00273     emitInstrumentation = false;
00274     generateDebuggingSymbols = false;
00275 
00276     ctx = new llvm::LLVMContext;
00277 
00278 #ifdef ISPC_IS_WINDOWS
00279     _getcwd(currentDirectory, sizeof(currentDirectory));
00280 #else
00281     getcwd(currentDirectory, sizeof(currentDirectory));
00282 #endif
00283 }

00290 
00291 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00292 // SourcePos
00293 
00294 SourcePos::SourcePos(const char *n, int l, int c) {
00295     name = n ? n : m->module->getModuleIdentifier().c_str();
00296     first_line = last_line = l;
00297     first_column = last_column = c;
00298 }
00299 
00300 llvm::DIFile SourcePos::GetDIFile() const {
00301 #ifdef LLVM_2_8
00302     return llvm::DIFile();
00303 #else
00304     std::string directory, filename;
00305     GetDirectoryAndFileName(g->currentDirectory, name, &directory, &filename);
00306     return m->diBuilder->createFile(filename, directory);
00307 #endif // LLVM_2_8
00308 }
00309 
00310 
00311 void
00312 SourcePos::Print() const { 
00313     printf(" @ [%s:%d.%d - %d.%d] ", name, first_line, first_column,
00314            last_line, last_column); 
00315 }
00316 
00317 
00318 bool
00319 SourcePos::operator==(const SourcePos &p2) const {
00320     return (!strcmp(name, p2.name) && 
00321             first_line == p2.first_line &&
00322             first_column == p2.first_column &&
00323             last_line == p2.last_line &&
00324             last_column == p2.last_column);
00325 }
